Description: Prigozhin's former political strategist Maxim Shugaley, detained in Chad in September, was returned to RussiaRIA Novosti reports that two more Russians returned with him - Evgeny Tsarev and Samer Soueifan, as well as one Belarusian A. Denisevich.They were held at the airport of the capital of Chad since September 19. The Russian Foreign Ministry stated that it had taken all necessary measures to ensure that all four people were released. Shugaley is known for being close to the murdered head of the Wagner PMC, Yevgeny Prigozhin. While working for Prigozhin, Shugaley visited the campaign headquarters of Mahamat Idris Deby Itno during the elections in Chad. Later in the country he was accused of interfering in internal affairs. Sueyfan worked with Shugaley as a translator. In 2019, Shugaley and Soueifan were captured in Libya during the civil war waged between the Government of National Accord (backed by some Western countries) and the Libyan National Army under the leadership of Field Marshal Khalifa Haftar (backed by Russia) ). Shugaley was suspected of meeting with Seif al-Islam Gaddafi, the son of the murdered Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi. Gaddafi Jr. is in opposition to the Government of National Accord. Based on the capture of Shugaley, a film of the same name -Shugaley- was released in 2020, which describes the events that happened to the political strategist in Libya.

Description: Gazprom stopped supplying gas to Austria The supply of gas to the Austrian energy company OMV from Russia stopped on the morning of November 16, saidAustrian Chancellor Karl Nehammer. The reason for this was the conflict over interrupted supplies in 2022. Austria received Russian gas through the Nord Stream gas pipeline, but in 2022, after Russia's invasion of Ukraine, supply disruptions arose. Gazprom explained this by technical difficulties, in response, the Head of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, said that -Russia is trying to blackmail Austria by stopping gas supplies.- Nehammer said the day before that the country -will not allow itself to be blackmailed.-Earlier, OMV filed a lawsuit against Gazprom and won more than ‚Ç¨243 million in damages. OMV decided to deduct this money from the payment for the existing contract. The company claims that it will replace Russian supplies with supplies from Italy, Germany and the Netherlands, as well as from other suppliers. According to DW, the Austrian corporation could deliberately come into conflict with the Russian one in order to break the contract valid until 2040, obliging it to purchase significant volumes of gas.
